txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: The eastern end of the Santa Monica Mountains stretches from Downtown to the Pacific Ocean and separates the Los Angeles Basin from the San Fernando Valley.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: In the early 1900s, the Los Angeles Times advocated for pronouncing it Loce AHNG-hayl-ais (), approximating Spanish [los ˈaŋxeles], by printing the respelling under its masthead for several years. This did not find favor.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: The Los Angeles area is also subject to phenomena typical of a microclimate, causing extreme variations in temperature in close physical proximity to each other.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: Los Angeles also hosted 8 FIFA World Cup soccer games at the Rose Bowl in 1994, including the final, where Brazil won.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: Los Angeles has twice hosted the Summer Olympic Games: in 1932 and in 1984, and will host the games for a third time in 2028.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: Los Angeles has twice hosted the Summer Olympic Games: in 1932 and in 1984, and will host the games for a third time in 2028. Los Angeles will be the third city after London (1908, 1948 and 2012) and Paris (1900, 1924 and 2024) to host the Olympic Games three times.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: The Forum, SoFi Stadium, Dignity Health Sports Park, the Rose Bowl, Angel Stadium and Honda Center are also in adjacent cities and cities in Los Angeles's metropolitan area. Los Angeles has twice hosted the Summer Olympic Games: in 1932 and in 1984, and will host the games for a third time in 2028.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles Lakers
txt_Facts.fact: Los Angeles stretched its postseason winning streak to nine games by taking the first contest of the NBA Finals from the 76ers.

txt_Facts.title: Greater Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: Meanwhile, the San Fernando Valley ("The Valley") is defined as the basin consisting of the part of Los Angeles and its suburbs that lie north-northwest of downtown and is ringed by mountains.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles Lakers
txt_Facts.fact: Los Angeles won 53 games in 1962–63, behind Baylor's 34.0 ppg and West's 27.1 ppg but lost in the NBA Finals in six games to the Celtics.

txt_Facts.title: X Games
txt_Facts.fact: The location of the Winter X Games is in Aspen, Colorado, through 2019, while the location for the Summer X Games has been in Los Angeles, changing to Austin, Texas, in June 2014.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles Dodgers
txt_Facts.fact: Since retirement in 2015, Bea's replacement and current organist is Dieter Ruehle, who also plays at Staples Center for Los Angeles Kings games.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: In the early 1900s, the Los Angeles Times advocated for pronouncing it Loce AHNG-hayl-ais (), approximating Spanish [los ˈaŋxeles], by printing the respelling under its masthead for several years.

txt_Facts.title: Greater Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: It is the only American city to host the Olympic games twice: once in 1932, and more recently in 1984. Los Angeles will also be the host of the 2028 Summer Olympics, becoming the third city to host three Olympic Games, after London and Paris.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles Dodgers
txt_Facts.fact: In just their second season in Los Angeles, the Dodgers won their second World Series title, beating the Chicago White Sox in six games in 1959.

txt_Facts.title: Los Angeles
txt_Facts.fact: Los Angeles will host the 2028 Summer Olympics and Paralympic Games, making Los Angeles the third city to host the Olympics three times.

img_Facts.title: Francis Crick sculpture - geograph.org.uk - 1411215
img_Facts.caption: Francis Crick sculpture - geograph.org.uk - 1411215 Francis Crick sculpture This sculpture, erected in December 2005, is dedicated to Francis Crick who was born in Weston Favell, Northampton and is viewed as one of the greatest British scientists of the 20th century. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1962 and the Order of Merit in 1991.
img_Facts.detailed_caption: The Francis Crick sculpture, located in Weston Favell, Northampton, is a prominent feature in the image. It is a modern, abstract representation of the renowned British scientist, capturing his essence through artistic expression. The sculpture is set against a clear blue sky, which enhances its visibility and prominence. The surrounding area appears to be an open space, possibly a public square or park, with no other notable architectural structures or people visible in the immediate vicinity. The sculpture's design is sleek and contemporary, reflecting the scientific and intellectual legacy of Francis Crick.

img_Facts.title: US Navy 050806-N-9769P-003 A Member of the U.S. Navy Parachute Team, the Leap Frogs, descends over downtown Los Angles during the 2005 Extreme Games
img_Facts.caption: US Navy 050806-N-9769P-003 A Member of the U.S. Navy Parachute Team, the Leap Frogs, descends over downtown Los Angles during the 2005 Extreme Games Los Angeles (Aug 6, 2005) -
img_Facts.detailed_caption: A member of the U.S. Navy Parachute Team, the Leap Frogs, descends with a yellow parachute marked "NAVY" over downtown Los Angeles. The sky is clear and blue, and the parachutist is surrounded by colorful smoke trails in red, green, and yellow, likely from accompanying aircraft. The event took place during the 2005 Extreme Games Los Angeles on August 6, 2005.
